reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: From the service and friendliness of all the staff to the rooms and grounds to the fabulous restaurant, it's an absolutely perfect luxury boutique hotel.
reviews.title: Beautiful hotel and excellent service
Charming if your mode is on "slow"
reviews.text: I like the concept of the place, called by management “rustic”; gravel pathway from the parking to the reception (gravel was getting into my open shoes and pulling my luggage was difficult), olive trees, old buildings, small water holes, beautiful and green palm garden, relative silence given that you can see highway from the main entrance. The cozy rooms have the necessary equipment; Wi-Fi (ask for a room where signal is easily available), plasma TV, small oil bottle offered as a gift, great bathroom (my suite no 10 had separate shower and toilet cabins, stylish glass sink, Bulgari shampoo and body cream).

I was staying in the hotel one night of August on business trip. Arriving at 20.00 I decided to have a swim and then dinner in the hotel restaurant. The swimming pool is small and “rustic” which means that water is slightly milky with various leaves and flowers floating on it. Hence, I skipped that part, even though the outside temperature was 32C and went straight for dinner. We took a choice of starters, which in particular for Iberic ham is good and comes in generous portions. The main dish was less good; the sea bass with Porcini mushrooms seem not to fit together, the mushrooms were giving to the fish an acid taste. At 22.00 we asked for a bill, we had to remind the waitress every 10 min that the bill did not arrive, finally we go it after 30 min. The waitress was very busy and visibly hardworking as she was serving probably 10 tables, the bill came from the “restaurant manager”, why so late? After the dinner I got finally to my room with the intention to work, I could connect but my colleague in suite no 11 was getting the network only around the bathroom area, not ideal for working late at night. The thermometer in my room was showing 29.6C (I assume it is internal temperature), but the air-conditioning system was set at 25C. However the temperature was not going down, I reset it at 21C, but in the morning I saw 28.4C, still not sure if inside or outside (?): the night was bearable but could have been cooler.
reviews.title: A lovely and excellent place where to stay

reviews.text: In the morning after a good bath I tried to use the hair dryer. Despite many buttons, including 3 options with thermometer drawn, I did not manage to get hot air to style my hair. I had a business meeting in the morning to which I showed up with hair “out of the swimming pool”. The first one at breakfast, I took my selection of yogurts, fruits and cold slices and was wondering why it is charged at EUR 19… Coffee was self-service and no one showed up for 20 minutes. When eventually I was asked about my choice of eggs cooked to my taste, I had finished my breakfast.
reviews.title: Beautiful

reviews.text: Coming back to my suite, after a short walk allowing me to admire small and lovely garden and listen to the doves, I tried to open the main door of the hotel section leading to my room, but my card was not active anymore. I passed to the reception, where girl quickly re-established my card saying I should not keep the card together with mobile (yes, both were in my bag).
